Detailed Description

Configuration object used by Agent.

This object is used to configure an instance of Agent.

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

Member Function Documentation

◆ Clear()

void IonicSecurity::SDK::AgentConfig::Clear ( )

Set all properties back to a default value.

After calling Clear(), the object will be equal to a newly instantiated config object using the default constructor AgentConfig::AgentConfig().

Get a configuration property string by name.

Parameters
[in]msNameThe parameter name.

◆ GetPropertyBool()

bool IonicSecurity::SDK::AgentConfig::GetPropertyBool ( String^  msName,
bool  bDefaultValue 
)

Get a configuration property boolean by name.

Parameters
[in]msNameThe parameter name.
[in]bDefaultValueThe default value to use, in case the parameter is not found or is empty.
Returns
If the property value is "0", "false", or "no", then the boolean value will be false. Otherwise, the boolean value will be true. The string comparison is case-insensitive.

Property Documentation

◆ HttpImpl

String^ IonicSecurity::SDK::AgentConfig::HttpImpl
getset

The HTTP implementation to use.

Parameters
[in]msHttpImplThe name of the HTTP implementation to use.

This field is used to specify a non-default HTTP implementation. Only set this field if you need an ISAgent object to use a custom HTTP implementation. See ISHTTP::create(const string&) for further information.

See also
ISHTTP, ISHTTP::create(const std::string&)
Returns
HTTP implementation name

◆ IsValid

bool IonicSecurity::SDK::AgentConfig::IsValid
get

Determine if the configuration is in a valid state.

Returns
True if valid, false otherwise
